definition:
**Definition.** Let $x_0$ be a of the real function $\Delta$. The
[*order of vanishing*]{} of $\Delta$ at $x_0$ is $n$, if
$\displaystyle\lim_{x\to x_0}\frac{\Delta(x)}{x^n}$ has a non-zero
finite value.

Usually, $x_0$ of the definition is 0.\
**Example.** If the curves $y = f(x)$ and $y = g(x)$ have in the point
$(x_0,\,y_0)$ the order of contact $n$, then the difference
$\Delta(h) := g(x_0+h)-f(x_0+h)$ of the ordinates has $n\!+\!1$-order of
vanishing.
